replies.bodyText:
Yes. Typically not a big deal unless you do monstrously big queries - but you're of course correct that streaming for this kind of thing is more efficient.
I'm fine with either way, also fine if you keep the example as-is @aschwarte10 - the point of this doc is not really to explore the different ways to process RDF4J query results of course :)
replies.author: jeenbroekstra

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the comments, very useful patterns for the examples, will keep them in mind for future changes
The purpose of this demo is is not the evaluation and consumption of the query, but rather the federation setup and specific configuration options. The system.out.println or in this example the count is just the simplest example. In here we in any case have something like 10 results only.
I would suggest to merge.
